intro: Chabraea elongata, commonly known as the slender chabraea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Chabraea elongata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
